DataElement.preferredName: Wechsler Intelligence Scale for Children - Fifth Edition Processing Speed Index Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric index score for processing speed based on the sum of scaled scores in the Wechsler Intelligence Scale for Children.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Wechsler Intelligence Scale for Children Processing Speed Scaled Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An individually administered clinical instrument for assessing the cognitive ability of children aged 6 years through 16 years 11 months. It is a psychometric test that assesses a child's current cognitive abilities in both verbal and nonverbal areas, including verbal comprehension, perceptual reasoning, working memory, and processing speed. It was first published in 1949 and revised in 1974 (WISC-R). The third edition (WISC-III) was released in 1991 and the fourth edition (WISC-IV) in 2003._The sum of the scaled scores for processing speed from subtests within selected scales for intelligence.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Wechsler Intelligence Scale for Children, Fourth Edition

An individually administered clinical instrument for assessing the cognitive ability of children aged
6 years through 16 years 11 months. It is a psychometric test that assesses a child's current cognitive abilities in
both verbal and nonverbal areas, including verbal comprehension, perceptual reasoning, working memory, and processing
speed.

Concepts.definition: An individually administered clinical instrument for assessing the cognitive ability of children aged 6 years through 16 years 11 months. It is a psychometric test that assesses a child's current cognitive abilities in both verbal and nonverbal areas, including verbal comprehension, perceptual reasoning, working memory, and processing speed. It was first published in 1949 and revised in 1974 (WISC-R). The third edition (WISC-III) was released in 1991 and the fourth edition (WISC-IV) in 2003.

Property.preferredDefinition: The sum of the scaled scores for processing speed from subtests within selected scales for intelligence.

Concepts.definition: The sum of the scaled scores for processing speed from subtests within selected scales for intelligence.
